metadata.Title: CVE-2017-10989 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
The getNodeSize function in ext/rtree/rtree.c in SQLite through 3.19.3, as used in GDAL and other products, mishandles undersized RTree blobs in a crafted database, leading to a heap-based buffer over-read or possibly unspecified other impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-10989` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

lemon - 3.8.2-1ubuntu2.2+esm1
libsqlite3-0 - 3.8.2-1ubuntu2.2+esm1
libsqlite3-tcl - 3.8.2-1ubuntu2.2+esm1
sqlite3 - 3.8.2-1ubuntu2.2+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: sqlite3 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.8.2-1ubuntu2.2+esm1').
